'Spycatcher: The Candid Autobiography of a Senior Intelligence Officer' (also
'Spycatcher'), is a book written by Peter Wright, former MI5 officer and
Assistant Director, and co-author Paul Greengrass. It was published first in
Australia. Its allegations proved scandalous on publication, but more so because
the British Government attempted to ban it, ensuring its profit and
notoriety.
categories: Article 10 of the European Convention on Human Rights
